column4: If you have the disk installed most hardware raid controllers can designate it as a hot spare and use it when another disk fails, but you'll have to give the controllor commands when you install the disk or else it doesn't know what you want to do withit
If you just plug a random disk in, it won't do anything to it until you tell it to. Some external NAS devices might be otherwise, but what I said should hold true for any card
